summary: An FBI intake document recording an anonymous female caller's report on 08/10/2020. The caller alleges her father, an attorney in Tarpon Springs, FL, was a former recruiter for Jeffrey Epstein, that she and her five siblings were 'sold' throughout childhood, and that she met Epstein at age four. She also claims to have taken a photograph of Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FBI intake report for child sex trafficking; alleged to have been involved with the anonymous caller from her childhood.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by the anonymous caller as being 'around' when she met Epstein at age four, and allegedly photographed with Prince Andrew in 2001.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Allegedly photographed with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001 by the anonymous caller.

connections.description: Implicitly connected as associates in the context of the anonymous caller's allegations; Maxwell was 'around' when the caller met Epstein.
Allegedly photographed together in 2001, according to the anonymous caller.

events.title: Photograph of Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The anonymous caller claims she was the one who took a photograph of Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Anonymous call to FBI NTOC
events.description: An anonymous female caller reported information to the FBI National Threat Operations Center regarding Jeffrey Epstein, child sex trafficking, and her father's alleged role as a recruiter.

keyFacts: An anonymous female caller reported her father, an attorney residing in Tarpon Springs, FL, was a former recruiter for Jeffrey Epstein.
The caller alleges she and her five siblings were 'sold' throughout their entire childhood and she met Epstein when she was four years old.
The caller claims to have taken a photograph of Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell in 2001.
The caller reported being 'under the thumb' of an unknown man who sells her and receives no money for it, and fears for the safety of her four-year-old child.
